Content: for a given notarization, the notaries are numbered from 0 to 63, the one that is 0 changes each notarization to give each notary equal chance over time to participate in notarization.

Author: jl777c#5810

Author: jl777c#5810

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so a deterministic algo is used to reduce the selected 13 for each notarization round, but still there are thousands of possible 13

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: a 64 bit number is used as a bitmask to denote the chose 13

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the requirement is that it starts from the current iterations node 0

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: must have 13 bits set

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and each node in the bitmask must have the identical data

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so this bitmask cant be created until several iterations of comms between all the nodes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: then nodes start proposing the mask to use

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: nodes tally what the other nodes see and determine which is most popular

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: they then switch if they are not already using the most popular mask

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: critical is that all 13 signers agree on the mask, as if the other nodes select a bitmask, but any of the 13 are not also in agreement, it wont sign it and the notarization wont work

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is somewhat similar to mining, randomized and hard to predict which 13 "win"
